intro: Thaspium barbinode, commonly known as the woolly thaspium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Thaspium barbinode is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its delicate foliage and historical use in traditional medicine.
